name: Kdtreegeocoder
body:
# Welcome to the kdtreeGeocoder
Simple reverse geoCoder algorithm written in java. Suitable for working with android and other java projects.

This is'nt my original creation but a modification and improvement on the project already done at
[AReallyGoodName](https://github.com/AReallyGoodName/OfflineReverseGeocode/tree/master/src/main/java/geocode)

Lets see how the library actually works.

Put the **NP.zip** file into the android projects assets folder.
This file will be used as the database for the cities of Nepal.

Then initialize the **ReverseGeoCoder** class with

`/*`
`This will initialize the reverse geocoder class with the NP.zip file from the assets and the "true" tells the geocoder to get the major cities only`
`*/`
`ReverseGeoCoder.initialize(getActivity().getAssets(),"NP.zip",true);`

`//from this point onward you can call the instance of the ReverseGeoCoder`
`//so to call the geocoder `

`GeoName geoName = ReverseGeoCoder.getInstance().nearestPlace(25.66,85.77);`

`//then the name of the city can be fetch from `
`String address =  geoName.name+", "+geoName.country;`

This is the basic way of how the code actually works in the original library.

## **The modification comes here**

You can use KDTreeGeoCoder class that will run a async task for you and do all the converting tasks, providing you with a clean dialog and a string address.

For that,

`ReverseGeoCoder.initialize(getActivity().getAssets(),"NP.zip",true);`

`KDTreeGeoCoder coderTask = new KDTreeGeoCoder(getApplicationContext(),1234,true,new OnGeoCodeCompleteListener(){`
    `public void onGeoCodeComplete(int requestCode, String geoName){`
        `//do work with the geoName and address here according to the requestCode`
    `}`
`});
